titles.title: Medicare Managed Care Cost Contract Continuation Act of 1999
To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to assure that Medicare beneficiaries have continued access under current contracts to managed health care through the Medicare cost contract program.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Ways and Means
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health and Environment.

bill.summary: 6/17/1999--Introduced. Medicare Managed Care Cost Contract Continuation Act of 1999 - Amends title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to permit the indefinite extension of current Medicare managed care cost contracts.
